contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Australian place | type = suburb | name = Haymarket | city = Sydney | state = nsw | image = Paddys markets sydney.jpg | caption = Sydney Market City building | lga = City of Sydney | postcode = 2000 | pop = 5,376 <ref name=census>{{Census 2011 AUS|id=SSC11089|name=Haymarket (State Suburb)|accessdate=10 May 2013|quick=on}}</ref> | area = 0.4 | est = | stategov = [[Electoral district of Sydney|Sydney]] | fedgov = [[Division of Sydney|Sydney]] | dist1 = | location1= | near-nw = [[Ultimo, New South Wales|Ultimo]] | near-n = Sydney CBD | near-ne = Sydney CBD | near-w = [[Ultimo, New South Wales|Ultimo]] | near-e = [[Surry Hills, New South Wales|Surry Hills]] | near-sw = [[Chippendale, New South Wales|Chippendale]] | near-s = [[Surry Hills, New South Wales|Surry Hills]] | near-se = [[Surry Hills, New South Wales|Surry Hills]] }} '''Haymarket''' is a locality of [[Sydney]]'s city centre, [[New South Wales]], [[Australia]]. It is located at the southern end of the [[Sydney central business district]] in the [[Local government in Australia|local government area]] of the [[City of Sydney]]. Haymarket includes much of Sydney's [[Chinatown, Sydney|Chinatown]], [[Thai Town, Sydney|Thaitown]] and [[Railway Square, Sydney|Railway Square]] localities. Haymarket is adjacent to [[Darling Harbour]] and is surrounded by the suburbs of [[Ultimo, New South Wales|Ultimo]], [[Chippendale, New South Wales|Chippendale]], [[Surry Hills, New South Wales|Surry Hills]] and the [[Sydney central business district|Sydney CBD]]. ==History== Sydney's produce markets were located in Haymarket from the early 20th century through to the 1980s when they were moved to a new site at [[Flemington, New South Wales|Flemington]]. [[Paddy's Markets]] still operate on part of the site of the vegetable markets as a produce and [[flea market]]. The 'Market City' complex contains the markets, [[The Peak Building|The Peak]] apartment building, a modern shopping centre featuring a food court, restaurants, boutiques, specialty shops and [http://www.amusementcity.com.au City Amusements] (Sydney's largest family fun centre) The outer walls of the original vegetable market, built in 1909, were preserved and restored as an example of Edwardian architecture. They were part of the original city markets—designed by city architect C.Broderick—which were bounded by Hay Street, Quay Street and Thomas Street. They were built to replace the old Belmore Market, which had failed because it was too far from Darling Harbour. The new markets included the Sydney City Markets building (Ultimo Road), designed by [[George McRae]] and built in 1910, and the Sydney Markets Bell Tower (Quay Street), built in 1911 and restored by the State Bank in 1985. The bell tower is now incorporated within the [[University of Technology, Sydney]].<ref>Sydney Architecture, John Haskell (UNSW Press) 1997, p.55</ref> ==Population== At the 2011 [[Census in Australia|Census]], there were 5,376 residents in Haymarket. The median age was 27 years and 50.8% of people were aged 20-29 years. More than half of Haymarket residents were attending an educational institution, with the majority of these people attending a tertiary or technical institution. Just 10.3% of residents were born in Australia. The most common other countries of birth were China 18.3%, Thailand 14.8%, Indonesia 10.8%, Korea, Republic of (South) 7.0% and Hong Kong 2.3%. More than 80% of people spoke a language other than English at home. The top languages spoken were Mandarin 17.0%, Thai 14.4%, Indonesian 9.6%, Cantonese 7.6% and Korean 6.4%.<ref name=census /> ==Transport== [[Central railway station, Sydney|Central railway station]] sits on the southern border. The [[Sydney Entertainment Centre]] is located in Haymarket, between Paddy's Market and Darling Harbour. Building 5 of the [[University of Technology, Sydney]] is located in Haymarket. Haymarket is also serviced by the [[Inner West Light Rail]] network with stations at [[Central MLR station|Central]], [[Capitol Square MLR station|Capitol Square]] and [[Paddy's Markets MLR station|Paddy's Markets]]. <gallery> File:CityMarkets.JPG|Aarons Hotel, formerly City Markets File:Vegetable market0003.jpg|Vegetable market building, Hay Street File:BellTower.JPG|City markets bell tower, Quay Street File:Marketcity.jpg|Market City File:SAM_0667.jpg|Hay St, view toward George St. </gallery> ==References== {{Reflist}} == External links == *[http://www.4a.com.au 4A Centre for Contemporary Asian Art] {{commons category|Haymarket, New South Wales}} {{Coord|-33.88092|151.20294|format=dms|type:city_region:AU-NSW|display=title}} {{Sydney City of Sydney suburbs}} [[Category:Suburbs of Sydney]]
